alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, Letcher and southeastern Perry Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eolia, or 7 miles south of Whitesburg, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eolia, Oven Fork and Day around 740 PM EDT. Dongola and Oscaloosa around 745 PM EDT. Ice and Trailer around 750 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Whitesburg, Ermine, Marlowe, Whitco, Colly, Bellcraft, Crown, Van, Mayking, Winters, Sergent, Southdown, Wright, Thornton, Millstone, Farraday, Jenkins, Fleming-Neon, Whitaker, Tolliver Town, Neon Junction, Chip, Cromona, Seco, Haymond and Fishpond Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
